config.question: Which of the following can be said to mark the beginning of the gay liberation movement in the United States?

answer_3.response: On the night of June 27, 1969, New York police raided the Stonewall Inn, a Greenwich Village bar frequented by “drag queens” and lesbians. A riot broke out. The next night, more than 400 police officers battled 2000 gay demonstrators in Greenwich Village. The two-day Stonewall Riots marked the beginning of the modern gay liberation movement.
